critique: This document establishes an emergency board to investigate a dispute between the Long Island Rail Road and labor organizations. It invokes Section 9A of the Railway Labor Act, preventing changes to the conditions out of which the dispute arose for 120 days. The order is signed by President Ronald Reagan. The document reflects a moderate approach to economic regulation by intervening in a labor dispute to maintain conditions and facilitate investigation. It doesn't directly address ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion.
